description: Excavation and basement extension, alterations to shopfront, upper ground floor extension, pavement lights at the front and installation of Air Source Heat Pump to the rear.
decision_conditions: <p>Sound insulation shall be installed between the commercial premises on the ground floor and residential premises on the first floor. The applicant shall provide a scheme of sound insulation that shall be submitted for approval to the Council’s Noise Section prior to the commence use of these residential units.</p><p>Reason: To obtain required sound insulation and prevent noise nuisance.</p>

<p>No development shall take place until a Basement Construction Method Statement has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.</p><p>This statement shall include details regarding:</p><p>1. Detailed site-specific analysis of hydrological and geotechnical local ground conditions,</p><p>2. Analysis of how the excavation of the basement may impact on the water table and any groundwater flow, and whether perched water is present,</p><p>3. Details of how flood risk, including risk from groundwater and surface water flooding has been addressed in the design, including details of any proposed mitigation measures,</p><p>4. Details of measures proposed to mitigate any risks in relation to land instability, and</p><p>5. Demonstration of how cumulative effects have been considered and</p><p>6. A scheme of measures to monitor ground movements protect neighbouring properties from land instability caused by the basement construction</p><p>All work shall be carried out and supervised by a suitably qualified person and the development shall thereafter be carried out in accordance with the details and measures thus approved in the Basement Construction Method Statement and Assessment.</p><p>Reason: Development must not commence before this condition is discharged to avoid hazard in relation to land instability and increased flood risk caused by the basement excavation.</p>

<p>Minimum requirements for Odour Control Discharge stack. The discharge stack should:</p><p>1. Discharge the extracted air not less than 1 m above the roof ridge of any building within 20 m of the building housing the commercial kitchen</p><p>2. If 1 cannot be complied with for planning reasons, then the extracted air shall be discharged not less than 1 m above the roof eaves or dormer window of the building housing the commercial kitchen. Additional odour control measures may be required</p><p>3. If 1 or 2 cannot be complied with for planning reasons, then an exceptionally high level of odour control will be required.</p><p>Environmental Protection strongly recommends against low level discharge and the use of weather cowl hats where residential or odour sensitive premises requiring natural ventilation are in close approximation.</p><p>If it is impossible to discharge at a high level, the applicant would have to employ a Recirculation System which does not discharge externally.</p><p>For information the acceptable re-circulation systems are currently provided by the following companies:</p><p>1. Reco-Air, 14 Heritage Park, Hayes Way, Cannock, Staffordshire, WS11 7LT</p><p>2. CK Direct Duct &amp;amp; Maintenance Ltd, Unit 15 Tresham Road, Orton Southgate, Peterborough, PE2 6SG</p><p>3. Purified Air Limited, Lyon House, Lyon Road, Romford, Essex RM1 2BG</p>

<p>Any new plant shall be installed, together with any associated ancillary equipment, so as to prevent the transmission of noise and vibration into neighbouring premises. The rated noise level from all plant and ancillary equipment shall not increase the existing background noise level (10dB below) when measured 1m external from the nearest residential or noise sensitive premises. An assessment of the expected noise levels shall be carried out by a suitably qualified (IOA accredited) and experienced acoustic consultant, in accordance with BS 4142:2014+A1:2019 ‘Methods for rating and assessing industrial and commercial sound,’ and any mitigation measures necessary to achieve the above required noise levels shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority in writing for approval.</p><p>The plant shall thereafter be installed and maintained in accordance with the approved details.</p><p>Reason: To protect acceptable local noise levels</p>

The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date of this permission.


REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

The Development hereby permitted shall only be carried out and completed strictly in accordance with the submitted plans hereby approved and any subsequent approval of details.


REASON: To ensure that the development hereby permitted is carried out in full accordance with the plans hereby approved.
